alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 8:46PM MST until August 19 at 11:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... southwest Yavapai County in central Arizona... * Until 1145 PM MST. * At 843 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain west of Peeples Valley and Congress, Arizona. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Yavapai County This includes the following highways... Highway 93 between mile markers 167 and 176. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Date Creek, North Fork Date Creek, Waterman Creek, Bullard Wash, Poplar Wash, Model Creek and Cottonwood Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
